item.title: Retro App Breakdown
item.description: I have started to breakdown mobile apps and make sense of why something exists within an app and what could have been better. Last weekend, I went through Retro App. You can go through the breakdown here . If you want to go through the onboarding experience, you can do so here. A couple of interesting observations that I came across while going through the app: Unlike Instagram’s social graph, Retro app has purposefully focused on restricting what you can see and share with your friends.

item.title: ID by amoamo Breakdown
item.description: I’ve been keeping track of the new app in town ID by amoamo and found its onboarding and user experience really refreshing as compared to most other social media apps. I even Tweeted about it which was caught up by some of their team members. This was quite innovative by @amoamoamo app. Explaining why you should invite your friends while humanising the experience . item.title: Deep Dives - Maker DAO
item.description: Maker DAO is a well-known protocol that has been a pioneer in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space. In 2021, Maker Foundation took a significant step towards decentralization by dissolving itself and spinning up a DAO. As someone who has delved deep into the inner workings of Maker DAO over the past two weeks, I’ve gathered valuable insights and resources that will help anyone start contributing to Maker DAO.
